Referenced by is_req_replayed_by_update().

int distribute_txn_replay_handle ( struct lu_env *  env,
struct target_distribute_txn_data *  tdtd,
struct distribute_txn_replay_req *  dtrq 
)

redo updates on MDT if needed.

During DNE recovery, the recovery thread (target_recovery_thread) will call this function to replay distribute txn updates on all MDTs. It only replay updates on the MDT where the update record is missing.

If the update already exists on the MDT, then it does not need replay the updates on that MDT, and only mark the sub transaction has been committed there.

Parameters:
[in] env execution environment
[in] tdtd target distribute txn data, which holds the replay list and all parameters needed by replay process.
[in] dtrq distribute txn replay req.
Return values:
0 if replay succeeds.

void tgt_boot_epoch_update ( struct lu_target *  lut  ) 

Update boot epoch when recovery ends.

The recovery is not yet finished and final queue can still be updated with resend requests. Move final list to separate one for processing

go through list of exports participated in recovery and set new epoch for them

return list back at once

Clear MULTI RPCS incompatibility flag if

  • target is MDT and
  • there is no client to recover or the recovery was aborted

update server epoch

int tgt_validate_obdo ( struct tgt_session_info *  tsi,
struct obdo *  oa 
)

Validate oa from client.

If the request comes from 2.0 clients, currently only RSVD seq and IDIF req are valid. a. objects in Single MDT FS seq = FID_SEQ_OST_MDT0, oi_id != 0 b. Echo objects(seq = 2), old echo client still use oi_id/oi_seq to pack ost_id. Because non-zero oi_seq will make it diffcult to tell whether this is oi_fid or real ostid. So it will check OBD_CONNECT_FID, then convert the ostid to FID for old client. c. Old FID-disable osc will send IDIF. d. new FID-enable osc/osp will send normal FID.

And also oi_id/f_oid should always start from 1. oi_id/f_oid = 0 will be used for LAST_ID file, and only being accessed inside OST now.

Definition at line 134 of file tgt_handler.c.

References CERROR, DOSTID, ENTRY, exp_connect_flags(), lu_fid::f_oid, lu_fid::f_seq, lu_fid::f_ver, FID_SEQ_ECHO, fid_seq_is_echo(), fid_seq_is_idif(), fid_seq_is_mdt0(), fid_seq_is_norm(), GOTO, lr_server_data::lsd_osd_index, lu_target::lut_lsd, obdo::o_oi, obdo::o_valid, OBD_CONNECT_FID, obd_export_nid2str(), OBD_MD_FLGROUP, OBD_MD_FLID, ost_id::oi, ost_id::oi_fid, ostid_id(), ostid_seq(), ostid_set_seq_mdt0(), ostid_to_fid(), RETURN, tgt_name(), tgt_th_info(), tgt_session_info::tsi_env, tgt_session_info::tsi_exp, tgt_session_info::tsi_tgt, tgt_thread_info::tti_fid1, and unlikely.
